meanings.definition: In a manner that is complaining or expressing discontent
meanings.sent1: She spoke whiningly about having to do her chores.
meanings.sent2: He always talks whiningly when he doesn't get his way.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed whiningly when it wanted more treats.
meanings.sent4: The car engine groaned whiningly as it struggled up the hill.
meanings.sent5: Her voice rose whiningly as she complained about the long line.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is characterized by a high-pitched, annoying sound
meanings.sent1: The dog barked whiningly at the mailman every morning.
meanings.sent2: The violin played whiningly in the orchestra.
meanings.sent3: The old door creaked whiningly whenever it was opened.
meanings.sent4: The wind howled whiningly through the cracks in the window.
meanings.sent5: The teapot whistled whiningly as it reached boiling point.
